attributes.action: Repeal or suspend the 2008 Climate Change act
attributes.additional_details: Even in the unlikely circumstances that CO2 emissions are a significant contribution to global warming, most of the world are not reducing emissions, so Britains efforts make no significant change. The cost of the 2008 Climate Change act implementation has been estimated as £18 billion per year. We cannot afford this, so the act should be repealed or at least suspended.
